examples.yoruba: Ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ṣe fi hàn pé, ní à wọn orílẹ̀-èdè kan, iye ọmọkùnrin tí a ń mú lọ gbà tọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn jẹ́ ìlọ́po méjì ti ọmọbìnrin.
examples.english: In some countries twice as many boys as girls are brought to health centers, explains a report from the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF).

examples.yoruba: Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó Tí Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-èdè Fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ pé, bí obìnrin náà “ṣe tara ṣà ṣà wá nǹkan ṣe, tí ọmọ rẹ̀ sì gba ìtọ́jú tó yẹ, ló jẹ́ kí ara ọmọ náà tètè yá.”
examples.english: According to UNICEF, because of her “quick response and access to community health care, her child's illness was cut short.”

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Manchester Guardian Weekly ti ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ń ṣà yọlò ìsọfúnni tí Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó Tí Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF), gbé já de ní òpin ọdún 1995, ó sọ pé: “Nínú à wọn ogun tó jà ní ẹ̀wá dún tó kọjá, mílíọ̀nù méjì à wọn ọmọdé ló kú, mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin sí má rùn-ún ló di alá àbọ̀ ara, mílíọ̀nù méjìlá ni kò rílé gbé, à wọn tó lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan ló di ọmọ òrukàn tà bí tí wọ́n yà nípa kúrò lọ́dọ̀ à wọn òbí wọn, à wọn mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá ni à ròdùn ti dà lórí rú.”
examples.english: Citing information provided by the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF), at the end of 1995, England's Manchester Guardian Weekly stated: “In the wars of the past decade, 2 million children have been killed, 4-5 million disabled, 12 million made homeless, more than 1 million orphaned or separated from their parents and 10 million psychologically traumatised.”

examples.yoruba: Ìròyìn tó wá lá ti ọ̀dọ̀ Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ pé: “Ní ọdún mẹ́wàá sẹ́yìn, ó lé ní mílíọ̀nù méjì ọmọdé tó gun pa, ó sì lé ní mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin tí a sọ di alá àbọ̀ ara, bá kan náà ni ogun ti sọ à wọn tó lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan di alá ìlóbìí tà bí kí wọ́n máà rí à wọn ìdílé wọn mọ́.”
examples.english: A report from the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF) said: “In the last decade, more than 2 million children have been killed during wars, while more than 4 million have survived physical mutilation and more than 1 million have been orphaned or separated from their families as a result of war.”

examples.yoruba: Ìròyìn Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ ní ọdún 1992 pé, “'gbígbé ogun dìde sí à wọn ọmọdé' jẹ́ ìhùmọ̀ ọ̀rúndún ogún.”
examples.english: In 1992 a United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF) report said that “'war on children' is a 20th century invention.”

examples.yoruba: Ìwé ìròyìn kan ní Gúúsù Áfíríkà tí wọ́n ń pè ní Sowetan fa ọ̀rọ̀ yọ lá tinú ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) gbé já de níbi ìpà dé à pérò ọ̀hún, ó sọ pé: “Ìwá dìí tí à jọUNICEFṣe fi hàn pé ìpín mọ́kà nléláà ádọ́ta nínú ọgọ́rùn-ún à wọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn jẹ́ mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún sí mọ́kà ndínlógún ní Gúúsù Áfíríkà ni kò mọ̀ pé ẹnì kan tá ra rẹ̀ jọ pé ó le dá ad áa lè ti kó kòkòrò à rùn éèdì, à ti pé ó lè tà taré rẹ̀ sí wọn.”
examples.english: The South African newspaper Sowetan commented on a report that was released at the conference by the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF): “Unicef's surveys found that 51 percent of girls aged 15 to 19 in South Africa did not know that someone who looks healthy can be infected with HIV and transmit it to them.”

examples.yoruba: Àní sẹ́, Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ròyìn pé nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin ọmọdé ló ń kú lọ́dọọdún níto rí ewu à wọn oúnjẹ míì tá wọn èèyàn fi ń rọ́pò ọmú ìyá.
examples.english: In fact, the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF) reports that some 4,000 children die every day as a result of hazards associated with breast-milk substitutes.

examples.yoruba: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ó ti lé ní à á dọ́ta ọdún bá yìí tí à jọUNICEFti ń pèsè oúnjẹ, aṣọ, à ti ìtọ́jú lọ́nà ti ìṣègùn fún à wọn ọmọdé já kèj ádò ayé, wọ́n sì ti ń gbìyà njú lá ti bójú tó ohun tí à wọn ọmọdé ṣalá ìní lá papọ̀.
examples.english: Thus, for over half a century, UNICEFhas been providing children throughout the world with food, clothing, and medical care and has been trying to look after children's needs in general.

examples.yoruba: Gẹgẹ biUNICEF(Ajọ Owó Akanlo Iparapọ Orilẹ-ede fun Awọn Ọmọde) ti wí, iyẹn ni iye bibanininujẹ ninu awọn ọmọde ti wọn kò tii pe ọdun marun-un ti wọn ń kú lọdọọdun fun à ìjẹunre-ká nú ati awọn aisan ti ó rọrun lati dènà ni awọn ilẹ ti ó ṣẹṣẹ ń goke à gbà.
examples.english: According to UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund), that is the appalling number of children under five who die of malnutrition and easily preventable diseases each year in developing lands.

examples.yoruba: ÀjọUNICEFṣèṣirò pé à á dọ́ta ọ̀kẹ́ ọmọdé tí ń kú lọ́dọọdún ni a ti lè gbà là bí à wọn ìyá bá ń fi ọmú bọ́ ọmọ fún oṣù mẹ́rin sí mẹ́fà à kọ́kọ́ nínú ìgbésí ayé à wọn ọmọ náà.
examples.english: UNICEFcalculates that a million child deaths each year could be avoided if mothers were to breast-feed babies for the first four to six months of their lives.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń rí sí ọ̀ràn gbígba ọmọ ẹlòmíràn ṣọmọ, à wọn ilé ìtọ́jú à wọn ọmọ òrukàn, Ibùdó Ìgbà là fún Àwọn Ọmọdé, à jọUNICEF, à ti à wọn à jọ à ti ẹgbẹ́ tó dà bíi wọn ṣe dá ad áa nípa gbígbìyà njú lá ti ṣèrà nwọ́ fún à wọn ọmọ tí òṣì ń ta.
examples.english: Adoption agencies, orphanages, SOS Children's Villages, UNICEF, and similar organizations or groups serve a good purpose when they try to provide support to underprivileged children.

examples.yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìròyìn kan tí ÀjọUNICEFgbé já de ní ọdún 1996, ojú ìwòye à wọn kan ni pé 'ìran à wọn ọ̀tá ọjọ́ iwá jú, tí í ṣe à wọn ọmọ tí à wọn ọ̀tá bí pà ápàá ni a gbọ́dọ̀ mú kúrò.'
examples.english: According to a 1996 report by UNICEF, the view of some is that 'future generations of the enemy, that is, the enemies' children, must also be eliminated.'

examples.yoruba: ÀjọUNICEFparí ọ̀rọ̀ pé: “Níto rí náà, bá wọn èèyàn bá ṣe kà wé tó ló ń pinnu bí à wọn ọmọdé ṣe ń kú tó ní orílẹ̀-èdè Benin à ti níbi gbogbo lá gbàá yé.”
examples.english: UNICEFconcludes: “The level of education is hence a determining factor in the infant mortality rate in Benin, as it is all over the world.”

examples.yoruba: Lá ti ṣà pèjúwe kókó wọn, à jọUNICEFfúnni ní à wọn kókó oníṣirò wọ̀nyí: Àfikún ìná wó tí a fojú bù lá ti ká jú à ìní ká rí ayé fún ìjẹunreká nú à ti ìtọ́jú ìlera ìpìlẹ̀ púpọ̀ tó jẹ́ bílíọ̀nù 13 dọ́là lọ́dún; fún ẹ̀kọ́ alá kọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀, bílíọ̀nù 6 dọ́là; fún fífa omi dá rad ára à ti ìmọ́tó tó, bílíọ̀nù 9 dọ́là; fún ìfètò-sọ́mọ-bíbí, bílíọ̀nù 6 dọ́là—ó jẹ́ à ròpọ̀ bílíọ̀nù 34 dọ́là lọ́dún.
examples.english: To illustrate their point, UNICEFgives the following figures: The estimated extra cost of meeting the worldwide need for adequate nutrition and basic health care is $13 billion a year; for primary education, $6 billion; for safe water and sanitation, $9 billion; for family planning, $6 billion—making a total of $34 billion a year.

examples.yoruba: ÀjọUNICEFwá pà rọwà pé ká wọn èèyàn fọwọ́ gidi mú ọ̀rọ̀ “à wọn ohun ìdá àbòbò tó jíire, à wọn nǹkan bí: à ṣíborí, dídín eré sísá ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà kù lá wọn à gbègbè téèyàn bá wà, à wọn ìjókòó tó ń dá àbò bo ọmọdé nínú ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà, bẹ́líìtì à à bò nínú ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà, à wọn ìdérí agolo oògùn tọ́mọdé kò ní lè ṣí, ká wọn ẹ̀rọ tó ń kófìrí èéfín máa wà nínú ilé, à ti pé kí ibi ìṣeré jẹ́ èyí tó lá àbò.”
examples.english: UNICEFurged that attention be given to “proven life-savers: helmets, speed limits in heavily populated areas, child-safety seats in cars, seat belts, child-safety caps on medicine, smoke detectors in homes, and playground safety standards.”

examples.yoruba: Bí ó ti wù kí ó rí, “gẹ́gẹ́ bí iye tí à jọ WHO [Àjọ Ìlera Àgbá yé] gbe já de kẹ́yìn ṣe fi hàn, nǹkan bí ìlọ́po mẹ́rin iye à wọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin tí ń pa ara wọn ni iye à wọn ọ̀dọ́kùnrin tí ń pa ara wọn.”—The Progress of Nations, tí ÀjọUNICEFgbé já de.
examples.english: However, “about four times as many young males as females commit suicide in the industrialized nations according to the latest figures from WHO [World Health Organization].”—The Progress of Nations, published by UNICEF.

examples.yoruba: Ìwá dìí kúlẹ̀kúlẹ̀ kan, tí à jọUNICEF(Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣe, fi hàn pé nǹkan bí 585,000 obìnrin ní ń kú lọ́dọọdún nígbà tí wọ́n lóyún à tí nígbà tí wọ́n ń bímọ.
examples.english: About 585,000 women die each year during pregnancy or while giving birth, says a new comprehensive survey by UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund).

examples.yoruba: Ìtẹ̀já de The State of the World's Children 1995, ìròyìn kan tí à jọUNICEF(Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣe, sọ pé kò bọ́gbọ́n mu lá ti ronú pé à gbá yé kò lè ká jú à wọn kòṣeémá nìí ṣíṣe kókó tí à wọn ọmọdé nílò.
examples.english: The State of the World's Children1995, a report by UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund), says that it is absurd to think that the world cannot afford to meet the essential needs of its children.

examples.yoruba: Ó dùn wá lá ti sọ pé ìròyìn kan tí à jọUNICEFgbé já de fi hàn pé ọwọ́ ìyà ò tán lá ra à wọn ọmọdé ní à wọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń gòkè à gbà lá àárín Ọdún Àwọn Ọmọdé ní Àgbá yé.
examples.english: Sad to say, according to a UNICEFreport, children in developing nations did not fare well during the International Year of the Child.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn à bá jáde ìwá dìí wọ̀nyí, tó jẹ́ apá kan ìwá dìí ọdọọdún ti Progress of Nations, tí à jọUNICEF(Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣètò rẹ̀, tún fi hàn pé, “à wọn à kọsílẹ̀ oníṣirò nípa ìmọ́tó tó wà lá ra à wọn tí ń burú sí i lá gbàá yé, wọn kò sunwọ̀n sí i.”
examples.english: These findings, part of the Progress of Nationsannual survey conducted by UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund), also reveal that “sanitation statistics are among those getting worse worldwide, not better.”

examples.yoruba: ÀjọUNICEFsọ pé lójoojúmọ́, nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún má rùn-ún sí méje à wọn ìkókó ló ń kó fá írọ́ọ̀sì tó ń pa agbá ra ìdènà à rùn lá tinú wà rà ìyá wọn.
examples.english: According to UNICEF, about 500 to 700 infants per day are infected by the breast milk of their HIV-positive mothers.

examples.yoruba: ÀjọUNICEFalá ra jẹ́wọ́ ní oṣù November 1999 pe, “à wọn ṣì ní ohun púpọ̀ lá ti ṣe,” ó sì ṣà làyé pé: “Já kèj ádò ayé, nǹkan bí à wọn ọmọdé tí iye wọ́n tó mílíọ̀nù méjìlá, tí wọn kò tíì pé ọmọ ọdún má rùn-ún ló ń kú lọ́dọọdún, à wọn ohun tí a lè dènà rẹ̀ ló sì ń pa èyí tó pọ̀ jù lọ lá ra wọn.
examples.english: Admitting in November 1999 that “much remains to be done,”UNICEFexplained: “Globally, an estimated 12 million children under the age of five die every year, mostly of easily preventable causes.

examples.yoruba: Lá ìpẹ́ yìí, à jọUNICEFsọ pé: “Àdéhùn náà ti yá ra di à déhùn lórí ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn tó ṣètẹ́wọ́gbà jù lọ, ó sì ń fún à wọn ọmọdé já kèj ádò ayé ní ìṣírí.”
examples.english: “The Convention,”UNICEFrecently noted, “has rapidly become the most widely accepted human rights treaty ever, creating a global momentum for children.”

examples.yoruba: ÀjọUNICEFwá sọ pé, lá ìka ìtọ́ni yìí sí, à wọn kan ṣì ń ṣi à wọn èèyàn lọ́nà nípa pípolówó pé “kò sí ìyà tọ̀ lá àárín oúnjẹ ọmọ tí wọ́n ṣe sínú agolo à ti ọmú.”
examples.english: Despite this recommendation, the UNICEFRegional Nutrition Adviser for Eastern and Southern Africa stated that false advertising persists in claiming that “infant formula is as good as breast milk.”

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Indian Express ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìròyìn à jọUNICEFnáà, ọ̀rọ̀ olóòtú inú rẹ̀ kédà árò pé ń ṣe ni Ọdún Àwọn Ọmọdé wá yọrí sí “ọ̀rọ̀ à pá rá tí ń pani lẹ́kún.”
examples.english: Commenting on the UNICEFreport, an editorial in the Indian Express newspaper complained that the Year of the Child turned out to be a “cruel joke.”

examples.yoruba: UNICEF
examples.english: United Nations Children's Fund

Translation of "UNICEF" into English

United Nations Children's Fund is the translation of "UNICEF" into English. Sample translated sentence: Ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ṣe fi hàn pé, ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè kan, iye ọmọkùnrin tí a ń mú lọ gbàtọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn jẹ́ ìlọ́po méjì ti ọmọbìnrin. ↔ In some countries twice as many boys as girls are brought to health centers, explains a report from the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

Translations of "UNICEF" into English in sentences, translation memory

Ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ṣe fi hàn pé, ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè kan, iye ọmọkùnrin tí a ń mú lọ gbàtọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn jẹ́ ìlọ́po méjì ti ọmọbìnrin.
In some countries twice as many boys as girls are brought to health centers, explains a report from the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF).
jw2019
Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkànlò Owó Tí Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-èdè Fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ pé, bí obìnrin náà “ṣe tara ṣàṣà wá nǹkan ṣe, tí ọmọ rẹ̀ sì gba ìtọ́jú tó yẹ, ló jẹ́ kí ara ọmọ náà tètè yá.”
According to UNICEF, because of her “quick response and access to community health care, her child’s illness was cut short.”
jw2019
Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ó ti lé ní àádọ́ta ọdún báyìí tí àjọ UNICEF ti ń pèsè oúnjẹ, aṣọ, àti ìtọ́jú lọ́nà ti ìṣègùn fún àwọn ọmọdé jákèjádò ayé, wọ́n sì ti ń gbìyànjú láti bójú tó ohun tí àwọn ọmọdé ṣaláìní lápapọ̀.
Thus, for over half a century, UNICEF has been providing children throughout the world with food, clothing, and medical care and has been trying to look after children’s needs in general.
jw2019
Gẹgẹ bi UNICEF (Ajọ Owó Akanlo Iparapọ Orilẹ-ede fun Awọn Ọmọde) ti wí, iyẹn ni iye bibanininujẹ ninu awọn ọmọde ti wọn kò tii pe ọdun marun-un ti wọn ń kú lọdọọdun fun àìjẹunre-kánú ati awọn aisan ti ó rọrun lati dènà ni awọn ilẹ ti ó ṣẹṣẹ ń goke àgbà.
According to UNICEF (United Nations Children’s Fund), that is the appalling number of children under five who die of malnutrition and easily preventable diseases each year in developing lands.
jw2019
Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Manchester Guardian Weekly ti ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ń ṣàyọlò ìsọfúnni tí Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkànlò Owó Tí Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF), gbé jáde ní òpin ọdún 1995, ó sọ pé: “Nínú àwọn ogun tó jà ní ẹ̀wádún tó kọjá, mílíọ̀nù méjì àwọn ọmọdé ló kú, mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin sí márùn-ún ló di aláàbọ̀ ara, mílíọ̀nù méjìlá ni kò rílé gbé, àwọn tó lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan ló di ọmọ òrukàn tàbí tí wọ́n yà nípa kúrò lọ́dọ̀ àwọn òbí wọn, àwọn mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá ni àròdùn ti dà lórí rú.”
Citing information provided by the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), at the end of 1995, England’s Manchester Guardian Weekly stated: “In the wars of the past decade, 2 million children have been killed, 4-5 million disabled, 12 million made homeless, more than 1 million orphaned or separated from their parents and 10 million psychologically traumatised.”
jw2019
Àjọ UNICEF ṣèṣirò pé àádọ́ta ọ̀kẹ́ ọmọdé tí ń kú lọ́dọọdún ni a ti lè gbà là bí àwọn ìyá bá ń fi ọmú bọ́ ọmọ fún oṣù mẹ́rin sí mẹ́fà àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìgbésí ayé àwọn ọmọ náà.
UNICEF calculates that a million child deaths each year could be avoided if mothers were to breast-feed babies for the first four to six months of their lives.
jw2019
Àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń rí sí ọ̀ràn gbígba ọmọ ẹlòmíràn ṣọmọ, àwọn ilé ìtọ́jú àwọn ọmọ òrukàn, Ibùdó Ìgbàlà fún Àwọn Ọmọdé, àjọ UNICEF, àti àwọn àjọ àti ẹgbẹ́ tó dà bíi wọn ṣe dáadáa nípa gbígbìyànjú láti ṣèrànwọ́ fún àwọn ọmọ tí òṣì ń ta.
Adoption agencies, orphanages, SOS Children’s Villages, UNICEF, and similar organizations or groups serve a good purpose when they try to provide support to underprivileged children.
jw2019
Ìròyìn tó wá láti ọ̀dọ̀ Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ pé: “Ní ọdún mẹ́wàá sẹ́yìn, ó lé ní mílíọ̀nù méjì ọmọdé tógun pa, ó sì lé ní mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin tí a sọ di aláàbọ̀ ara, bákan náà ni ogun ti sọ àwọn tó lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan di aláìlóbìí tàbí kí wọ́n máà rí àwọn ìdílé wọn mọ́.”
A report from the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) said: “In the last decade, more than 2 million children have been killed during wars, while more than 4 million have survived physical mutilation and more than 1 million have been orphaned or separated from their families as a result of war.”
jw2019
Ìròyìn Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ ní ọdún 1992 pé, “‘gbígbé ogun dìde sí àwọn ọmọdé’ jẹ́ ìhùmọ̀ ọ̀rúndún ogún.”
In 1992 a United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) report said that “‘war on children’ is a 20th century invention.”
jw2019
Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ UNICEF gbé jáde ní ọdún 1996, ojú ìwòye àwọn kan ni pé ‘ìran àwọn ọ̀tá ọjọ́ iwájú, tí í ṣe àwọn ọmọ tí àwọn ọ̀tá bí pàápàá ni a gbọ́dọ̀ mú kúrò.’
According to a 1996 report by UNICEF, the view of some is that ‘future generations of the enemy, that is, the enemies’ children, must also be eliminated.’
jw2019
Àjọ UNICEF parí ọ̀rọ̀ pé: “Nítorí náà, báwọn èèyàn bá ṣe kàwé tó ló ń pinnu bí àwọn ọmọdé ṣe ń kú tó ní orílẹ̀-èdè Benin àti níbi gbogbo lágbàáyé.”
UNICEF concludes: “The level of education is hence a determining factor in the infant mortality rate in Benin, as it is all over the world.”
jw2019
Ìwé ìròyìn kan ní Gúúsù Áfíríkà tí wọ́n ń pè ní Sowetan fa ọ̀rọ̀ yọ látinú ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkànlò Owó ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) gbé jáde níbi ìpàdé àpérò ọ̀hún, ó sọ pé: “Ìwádìí tí àjọ UNICEF ṣe fi hàn pé ìpín mọ́kànléláàádọ́ta nínú ọgọ́rùn-ún àwọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn jẹ́ mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún sí mọ́kàndínlógún ní Gúúsù Áfíríkà ni kò mọ̀ pé ẹnì kan tára rẹ̀ jọ pé ó le dáadáa lè ti kó kòkòrò àrùn éèdì, àti pé ó lè tàtaré rẹ̀ sí wọn.”
The South African newspaper Sowetan commented on a report that was released at the conference by the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF): “Unicef’s surveys found that 51 percent of girls aged 15 to 19 in South Africa did not know that someone who looks healthy can be infected with HIV and transmit it to them.”
jw2019
Láti ṣàpèjúwe kókó wọn, àjọ UNICEF fúnni ní àwọn kókó oníṣirò wọ̀nyí: Àfikún ìnáwó tí a fojú bù láti kájú àìní kárí ayé fún ìjẹunrekánú àti ìtọ́jú ìlera ìpìlẹ̀ púpọ̀ tó jẹ́ bílíọ̀nù 13 dọ́là lọ́dún; fún ẹ̀kọ́ alákọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀, bílíọ̀nù 6 dọ́là; fún fífa omi dáradára àti ìmọ́tótó, bílíọ̀nù 9 dọ́là; fún ìfètò-sọ́mọ-bíbí, bílíọ̀nù 6 dọ́là—ó jẹ́ àròpọ̀ bílíọ̀nù 34 dọ́là lọ́dún.
To illustrate their point, UNICEF gives the following figures: The estimated extra cost of meeting the worldwide need for adequate nutrition and basic health care is $13 billion a year; for primary education, $6 billion; for safe water and sanitation, $9 billion; for family planning, $6 billion—making a total of $34 billion a year.
jw2019
Àjọ UNICEF wá pàrọwà pé káwọn èèyàn fọwọ́ gidi mú ọ̀rọ̀ “àwọn ohun ìdáàbòbò tó jíire, àwọn nǹkan bí: àṣíborí, dídín eré sísá ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà kù láwọn àgbègbè téèyàn bá wà, àwọn ìjókòó tó ń dáàbò bo ọmọdé nínú ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà, bẹ́líìtì ààbò nínú ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà, àwọn ìdérí agolo oògùn tọ́mọdé kò ní lè ṣí, káwọn ẹ̀rọ tó ń kófìrí èéfín máa wà nínú ilé, àti pé kí ibi ìṣeré jẹ́ èyí tó láàbò.”
UNICEF urged that attention be given to “proven life-savers: helmets, speed limits in heavily populated areas, child-safety seats in cars, seat belts, child-safety caps on medicine, smoke detectors in homes, and playground safety standards.”
jw2019
Bí ó ti wù kí ó rí, “gẹ́gẹ́ bí iye tí àjọ WHO [Àjọ Ìlera Àgbáyé] gbe jáde kẹ́yìn ṣe fi hàn, nǹkan bí ìlọ́po mẹ́rin iye àwọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin tí ń pa ara wọn ni iye àwọn ọ̀dọ́kùnrin tí ń pa ara wọn.”—The Progress of Nations, tí Àjọ UNICEF gbé jáde.
However, “about four times as many young males as females commit suicide in the industrialized nations according to the latest figures from WHO [World Health Organization].”—The Progress of Nations, published by UNICEF.
jw2019
Ìwádìí kúlẹ̀kúlẹ̀ kan, tí àjọ UNICEF (Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣe, fi hàn pé nǹkan bí 585,000 obìnrin ní ń kú lọ́dọọdún nígbà tí wọ́n lóyún àtí nígbà tí wọ́n ń bímọ.
About 585,000 women die each year during pregnancy or while giving birth, says a new comprehensive survey by UNICEF (United Nations Children’s Fund).
jw2019
Ìtẹ̀jáde The State of the World’s Children 1995, ìròyìn kan tí àjọ UNICEF (Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣe, sọ pé kò bọ́gbọ́n mu láti ronú pé àgbáyé kò lè kájú àwọn kòṣeémánìí ṣíṣe kókó tí àwọn ọmọdé nílò.
The State of the World’s Children 1995, a report by UNICEF (United Nations Children’s Fund), says that it is absurd to think that the world cannot afford to meet the essential needs of its children.
jw2019
Ó dùn wá láti sọ pé ìròyìn kan tí àjọ UNICEF gbé jáde fi hàn pé ọwọ́ ìyà ò tán lára àwọn ọmọdé ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń gòkè àgbà láàárín Ọdún Àwọn Ọmọdé ní Àgbáyé.
Sad to say, according to a UNICEF report, children in developing nations did not fare well during the International Year of the Child.
jw2019
Àní sẹ́, Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ròyìn pé nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin ọmọdé ló ń kú lọ́dọọdún nítorí ewu àwọn oúnjẹ míì táwọn èèyàn fi ń rọ́pò ọmú ìyá.
In fact, the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) reports that some 4,000 children die every day as a result of hazards associated with breast-milk substitutes.
jw2019
Àwọn àbájáde ìwádìí wọ̀nyí, tó jẹ́ apá kan ìwádìí ọdọọdún ti Progress of Nations, tí àjọ UNICEF (Àjọ Àkànlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣètò rẹ̀, tún fi hàn pé, “àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ oníṣirò nípa ìmọ́tótó wà lára àwọn tí ń burú sí i lágbàáyé, wọn kò sunwọ̀n sí i.”
These findings, part of the Progress of Nations annual survey conducted by UNICEF (United Nations Children’s Fund), also reveal that “sanitation statistics are among those getting worse worldwide, not better.”
jw2019
Àjọ UNICEF sọ pé lójoojúmọ́, nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún sí méje àwọn ìkókó ló ń kó fáírọ́ọ̀sì tó ń pa agbára ìdènà àrùn látinú wàrà ìyá wọn.
According to UNICEF, about 500 to 700 infants per day are infected by the breast milk of their HIV-positive mothers.
jw2019
Àjọ UNICEF alára jẹ́wọ́ ní oṣù November 1999 pe, “àwọn ṣì ní ohun púpọ̀ láti ṣe,” ó sì ṣàlàyé pé: “Jákèjádò ayé, nǹkan bí àwọn ọmọdé tí iye wọ́n tó mílíọ̀nù méjìlá, tí wọn kò tíì pé ọmọ ọdún márùn-ún ló ń kú lọ́dọọdún, àwọn ohun tí a lè dènà rẹ̀ ló sì ń pa èyí tó pọ̀ jù lọ lára wọn.
Admitting in November 1999 that “much remains to be done,” UNICEF explained: “Globally, an estimated 12 million children under the age of five die every year, mostly of easily preventable causes.
jw2019
Láìpẹ́ yìí, àjọ UNICEF sọ pé: “Àdéhùn náà ti yára di àdéhùn lórí ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn tó ṣètẹ́wọ́gbà jù lọ, ó sì ń fún àwọn ọmọdé jákèjádò ayé ní ìṣírí.”
“The Convention,” UNICEF recently noted, “has rapidly become the most widely accepted human rights treaty ever, creating a global momentum for children.”
jw2019
Àjọ UNICEF wá sọ pé, láìka ìtọ́ni yìí sí, àwọn kan ṣì ń ṣi àwọn èèyàn lọ́nà nípa pípolówó pé “kò sí ìyàtọ̀ láàárín oúnjẹ ọmọ tí wọ́n ṣe sínú agolo àti ọmú.”
Despite this recommendation, the UNICEF Regional Nutrition Adviser for Eastern and Southern Africa stated that false advertising persists in claiming that “infant formula is as good as breast milk.”
jw2019
Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Indian Express ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìròyìn àjọ UNICEF náà, ọ̀rọ̀ olóòtú inú rẹ̀ kédàárò pé ńṣe ni Ọdún Àwọn Ọmọdé wá yọrí sí “ọ̀rọ̀ àpárá tí ń pani lẹ́kún.”
Commenting on the UNICEF report, an editorial in the Indian Express newspaper complained that the Year of the Child turned out to be a “cruel joke.”
jw2019

examples.yoruba: Lá ti à wọn ọ̀rúndún wọ̀nyí wá ni ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì à wọn Ọmọlẹ́yìn Waldo ti fìdí múlẹ̀ lá wọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó jìnnà gan-an sí ilẹ̀ Faransé bíUruguayà ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Amẹ́ríkà.
examples.english: Over the centuries, Waldensian churches have been established in countries as far away from France as Uruguayand the United States.

examples.yoruba: Iṣẹ́ à gbègbè wa gbé wa dé à à là ilẹ̀ à wọn aráUruguayní gúúsù, Paraguay ní ìwọ̀-oòrùn, ìpínlẹ̀ Pernambuco ní à ríwá, à ti Òkun Atlantic ní ìhà ìlà-oòrun Brazil.
examples.english: Our district took us to the Uruguayanborder on the south, Paraguay on the west, the state of Pernambuco in the north, and the Atlantic Ocean on the eastern side of Brazil.

examples.yoruba: Atamá tàsé agbá bọ́ọ̀lù ọwọ́ iwá jú fúnUruguay, Luiz Suarez ló gbá à mì-ayò kí nní wọlé nísè̩ẹ́jú mẹ́wàá sáà à kọ́kọ́ tí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ lá ti mukò̩ ò̩hún darí.
examples.english: Luiz Suarez gave Uruguaya 10th minute lead with a sublime free kick that beat the Russian wall to give the South Americans the lead.

examples.yoruba: Nígbẹ̀yìngbẹ́yín, ọkọ̀ ojú omi ayá ra-bí-à ṣá mẹ́ta tí ó jẹ́ ti ilẹ̀ Britain dá Graf Spee lọ́nà, wọ́n sì kọ lù ú, èyí tí ó yọrí sí òfò ẹ̀mí à ti fífipá mú ọkọ̀ ojú omi náà lá ti forí lé èbútéUruguayti Montevideo fún à túnṣe.
examples.english: Finally, three British cruisers tracked down and attacked the Graf Spee, causing loss of life and forcing the ship to limp into the Uruguayanharbor of Montevideo for repairs.

examples.yoruba: ÌjọbaUruguaypà ṣẹ kí ọkọ̀ ogun ojú omi náà padà sí orí òkun kíá mọ́sá, à ìjẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ òun kì yóò jẹ́ kí ó lọ mọ́.
examples.english: The Uruguayangovernment ordered the battleship back to sea immediately, otherwise it would be interned.

examples.yoruba: Adùn ìdíje à gbá yé fún Russia forís̩á npó̩n ló̩jó̩ ajé bíUruguays̩e fà gbà han ikọ̀ náà pẹ̀lú 3-0.
examples.english: Russia's World Cup honeymoon feel came crashing down on Monday as they were pounded 3-0 by Uruguay.

examples.yoruba: Àwọn ará bìnrin méjì ń wà ásù fún ọkùnrin kan nínú ṣọ́ọ̀bù rẹ̀ nílùú Montevideo, olú ìlúUruguay
examples.english: Two sisters share a timely message with a store owner in Montevideo, capital of Uruguay

examples.yoruba: Uruguaylé téń té group A, pẹ̀lú à mì mẹ́sàn-án láì mà wò̩n wo̩n.
examples.english: Uruguaytopped group A with 9 points with no goals conceded.

examples.yoruba: NíUruguay, ọkùnrin mìíràn tí orúkọ rẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Luis kò lá yọ̀ rá rá.
examples.english: In Uruguay, another man named Luis was far from happy.

examples.yoruba: Ẹlẹ́rìí kan tí ń ṣèbẹ̀wò lá ti ilé dé ilé níUruguayfi ìwé à ṣà rò kúkúrú sílẹ̀ fún ọkùnrin kan.
examples.english: A Witness visiting from house to house in Uruguayplaced a tract with a man.

examples.yoruba: Ìṣirò lọ́ọ́lọ́ọ́ ti igbó olóoru tí à ń pa run jẹ́ nǹkan bí 150,000 sí 200,000 kìlómítà níbùú lóròó lọ́dún, ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó bi tóUruguay.
examples.english: Latest estimates put the destruction of tropical forests at between 60,000 [150,000] and 80,000 [200,000 sq km] square miles every year, about the size of Uruguay.

examples.yoruba: Kristẹni kan níUruguaykọ̀wé pé: “Mo dúpẹ́ mo tún ọpẹ́ dá lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà fún inú rere à ìlẹ́tọ̀ọ́sí rẹ̀ à ti fún ìbá dọ́rẹ̀ẹ́ rẹ̀.”
examples.english: A Christian in Uruguaywrites: “My heart swells with appreciation, and I am moved to thank Jehovah for his undeserved kindness and for his friendship.”

examples.yoruba: Ó kọ́kọ́ sìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí míṣọ́nná rì, níUruguay, lẹ́yìn náà ní Kòlóń bíà, ó sì ń bá iṣẹ́ náà lọ bá yìí ní Puerto Rico.
examples.english: She has served as a missionary first in Uruguay, then in Colombia, and now in Puerto Rico.

examples.yoruba: Ọdún 1927 ni wọ́n bí mi ní orílẹ̀-èdèUruguaytó wà lá àárín orílẹ̀-èdè Ajẹntínà à ti Brazil, Olódùmarè sì fi à yíká rírẹwà tó pọ̀ gan-an jíǹkí orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀hún ní apá Etíkun Àtìláń tíìkì.
examples.english: I was born in 1927 in Uruguay, a small pear-shaped country situated between Argentina and Brazil and favored with miles of beautiful scenery along the Atlantic Coast.

examples.yoruba: Ṣà gbéyẹ̀wò ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí à wọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin méjì tí wọn kò tíì pé ọmọ ogún ọdún tí wọ́n ń gbé ní orílẹ̀-èdèUruguay.
examples.english: Consider what happened to two teenage sisters in Uruguay.

examples.yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, nínú ipò à tẹ tuntun ọ̀hún lá gbàá yé, orílẹ̀-èdè Germany, Brazil à ti Belguim síì dipò wọn mú ní ìtẹ̀léǹtẹ̀lé, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni, Russia, Poland atiUruguayláǹfà àní lá ti wà lá àrin ipò kí nní sí ogún.
examples.english: While the top three positions in the world are unchanged as Germany, Brazil and Belguim sit respectively, Russia-bound duo of Poland and Uruguayhave succeeded in making strides within the top 20.

examples.yoruba: --- Ìdíje à gbá áyé:Uruguaygbonwúro sójú Russia 3-0.
examples.english: --- World Cup:Uruguaypounds hosts Russia 3-0

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí wọ́n gbọ́ bẹ́ẹ̀, ẹgbẹ́ à wọn ọlọ́rọ̀ oníṣòwò ní United States há yà ọkọ̀ òfuurufú kan, tí ó ná ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ní 2,500 dọ́là, lá ti lọ síUruguaylá ti lọ wo ìjà tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti ń ṣàn náà.
examples.english: Hearing of this, a party of wealthy businessmen in the United States chartered a plane, at a cost of about $2,500 a head, to fly to Uruguayto witness the gory battle.

examples.yoruba: Síbẹ̀ wọ́n máa ń sọ̀rọ̀ kan ní orílẹ̀-èdèUruguaypé: “No hay mal que por bien no venga,” “Kò sí bí nǹkan ṣe lè burú tó kí à yè ọpẹ́ má wà níbẹ̀.”
examples.english: Still, in Uruguaythere is a popular expression “No hay mal que por bien no venga,” “Nothing is so bad that something good cannot come from it.”

examples.yoruba: □ Iriri miiran ti ó fi ọgbọn jijẹrii lọna à ìjẹ́-bí-à ṣà han wá lati Kampala, Uganda.
examples.english: □ Another experience that shows the wisdom of informal witnessing comes from Kampala, Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Mo ti rí ìjọ ilú mi, tí ó ti gbèrú, tí a sì pín ní ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹrin, tí ó rán à wọn akéde à ti à wọn aṣá ájú ọ̀nà já de, à wọn kan gẹ́gẹ́ bí míṣọ́nná rì lọ sí à wọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí ó jìnnà sí ara wọ́n bí Bolivia, Laos, à tiUganda.
examples.english: I have seen my home congregation grow and divide four times, sending out publishers and pioneers, some as missionaries to countries as far apart as Bolivia, Laos, and Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Nǹkan bí ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn ni à lùf áà yìí yè bọ́ nínú ogun gbígbóná janjan tí wọ́n gbé dìde sí ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì rẹ̀ níUganda.
examples.english: Some 20 years ago, he survived the violent purges of his church in Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Nínú kòtò ìhà ìwọ̀ oòrùn, à wọn à sokọ́ra òkè ń láń lá ayọná yèéfín kóra jọ, wọ́n sì di à wọn à farakọ́ra òkè ń lá Ruwenzori à ti Virunga tí ó wà gá tagàta ní à wọn ẹnu à à là Rwanda, Zaire, à tiUganda.
examples.english: In the western rift, volcanic movement has formed the Ruwenzori and Virunga mountain ranges that straddle the borders of Rwanda, Zaire, and Uganda.

examples.yoruba: (Iṣe 15:30-32) Ìsà lẹ̀: Alá bòójútó à yíká ń bá ìjọ kan sọ̀rọ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdèUganda.
examples.english: (Acts 15:30-32) Bottom: A circuit overseer speaks to a congregation in Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Iye yii ko kan awọn wọnni ti a pa ninu diẹ lara awọn ogun atajẹsilẹ julọ ti o ṣẹṣẹ wa si opin ni ọdun ti o ṣaaju, iru bii tiUganda, Afghanistan, ati Iran oun Iraq.
examples.english: This figure excludes those killed in some of the bloodiest wars that had just come to a halt in the previous year, such as those in Uganda, Afghanistan, and Iran-Iraq.

examples.yoruba: Ọ̀ọ́dúnrún mìíràn ń gbé inú igbó dídí ilẹ̀Ugandatí kò ṣeé wọ̀.
examples.english: Another 300 dwell in the impenetrable forest in Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Ipò tá a wà náà ni Brian òun Marion Wallace à tà wọn ọmọ wọn méjèèjì wa, à wọn náà sì pinnu lá ti dúró síUganda.
examples.english: Brian and Marion Wallace and their two children were in a position similar to ours, and they also decided to stay in Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Gbogbo nǹkan ń lọ déédéé títí di à á rọ̀ ọjọ́ kan tá a gbọ́ lórí rédíò pé ìjọba ilẹ̀Ugandati fòfin de à wa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
examples.english: Conditions remained calm until one morning when we heard on the radio that the Ugandagovernment had banned Jehovah's Witnesses.

examples.yoruba: Ọdún 1937 ni wọ́n kọ́kọ́ mọ kòkòrò à rùn tó ń jẹ́ West Nile, ní orílẹ̀-èdèUganda, ẹ̀fọn ló sì sá bà ń kó o ran à wọn èèyàn. Lẹ́yìn èyí ni wọ́n tún ṣà kí yèsí rẹ̀ ní Àá rín Gbùngbùn Ìlà Oòrùn ayé, ilẹ̀ Éṣíà, à gbègbè Oceania, à ti ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù.
examples.english: West Nile virus, transmitted to man primarily by mosquitoes, was first isolated in 1937 in Ugandaand later observed in the Middle East, Asia, Oceania, and Europe.

examples.yoruba: Kò pẹ́ tí Knut à ti Lisbeth fi rí i pé à wọn ti wà ní sẹpẹ́ lá ti lọ sìn ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè. Torí náà, wọ́n lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdèUganda.
examples.english: Before long, Knut and Lisbeth felt ready to make the move, and a big one at that —to Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Abẹ́ à wọn igi máń gòrò kan tó ní ibòji dá ad áa ni ìjọ kékeré kan tó wà ní à ríwáUgandati ń ṣèpà dé tẹ́lẹ̀.
examples.english: A small congregation in northern Ugandaused to hold meetings under some densely leaved mango trees.

examples.yoruba: Lá sìkò tá a fẹ́ ṣe à péjọ yẹn, póòpù ń bọ̀ wá sí orílẹ̀-èdèUganda, à wọn èèyàn sì ń múra sílẹ̀ dè é.
examples.english: At the time, people were preparing for the pope's visit.

examples.yoruba: Kò pẹ́ lẹ́yìn náà ni mo sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní Pá pákọ̀ Òfuurufú Ńlá ti Entebbe lórílẹ̀-èdèUganda, níbi tá a ti lo ọdún mẹ́rin à ti oṣù méje.
examples.english: Not long thereafter, I received employment at Entebbe International Airport, in Uganda, where we would stay for four years and seven months.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tá a wà ní orílẹ̀-èdèUganda, ẹ̀ẹ̀mejì ni rògbòdìyàn ń lá bẹ́ sílẹ̀, à mọ́ èyí kò dá à wọn ìgbòkègbodò tẹ̀mí wa dúró rá rá.
examples.english: Civil unrest broke out twice in Ugandawhile we were there, but that did not bring our spiritual activities to a halt.

examples.yoruba: Àwa tá a kù níUgandasì ń ṣe à wọn ìpà dé ìjọ nìṣó, bẹ́ẹ̀ la sì ń bá iṣẹ́ ìwà ásù wa lọ, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọgbọ́n la fi ń ṣe é.
examples.english: Those of us left in Ugandakept on with our Christian meetings and the preaching work, although we had to be prudent and cautious.

examples.yoruba: Àmọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ rẹpẹtẹ èèyàn tó ti sá wá síUgandaníto rí ogun tí wọ́n ń jà lá wọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó wà lá gbègbè ibẹ̀ ń fẹ́ à fiyèsí ní ká njúk ánjú.
examples.english: However, an urgent concern is the large number of refugees who have streamed into Uganda.

examples.yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí mo sìn níUgandafún sáà kan, mo dé Dar es Salaam, tí í ṣe olú ìlú Tanganyika, níbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 1956.
examples.english: After serving in Ugandafor some time, I arrived early in 1956 in Dar es Salaam, the capital of Tanganyika.

examples.yoruba: Lá ti fi hàn bí ilẹ̀Ugandaṣe lọ́ràá tó, wọ́n máa ń pa á lá ṣamọ̀ níbẹ̀ pé tó o bá ti igi lá sán bọ ilẹ̀Ugandalá lẹ́, tó bá fi máa dà árọ̀ yóò ti ta gbòǹgbò.
examples.english: It has been said that if you drive a stick into the fertile soil of Ugandain the evening, it will have roots in the morning.

examples.yoruba: Lọ́dún 1971, ogun abẹ́lé tó ṣẹlẹ̀ kò jẹ́ ká ní ìfọ̀kà nbalẹ̀ mọ́ níUganda.
examples.english: In 1971 civil war shattered our peace in Uganda.

examples.yoruba: NíUganda, Stanley à ti Esinala Makumba jẹ́ orísun ìṣírí fún ìdílé wa
examples.english: In Uganda, Stanley and Esinala Makumba were a source of encouragement to our family

examples.yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà Ọlọ́run pé ó ṣì fà yè sílẹ̀ kí púpọ̀ sí i lá ra à wọn èèyàn onírúurú ẹ̀yà tó wà níUgandalè gbọ́ nípa Ìjọba rẹ̀.
examples.english: We thank Jehovah God for allowing time for yet more of Uganda'sdiverse people to learn about his Kingdom.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Africa News ti June 22, 2006, ń ṣà làyé nípa “à pérò kan tó dá lórí ìṣekúṣe à ti wíwo à wọn ohun tó ń mú ọkàn èèyàn fà sí ìṣekúṣe,” èyí tó máa ń wá yé lá wọn ilé jẹ́gẹjẹ̀gẹ tí wọ́n kọ́ sapá ibì kan bá yìí lórílẹ̀-èdèUganda, ó sọ pé “pípa tá wọn òbí pa à wọn ọmọ wọn tì ló mú kí iṣẹ́ aṣẹ́wó à ti lílo oògùn olóró pọ̀ sí i lá dùúgbò náà.”
examples.english: Africa News of June 22, 2006, reporting on a “workshop on sexual abuse and pornography” in slums in one part of Uganda, said it is the “parent's neglect that has increased prostitution and drug abuse in the area.”

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí iṣẹ́ kí kọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lá pá gúúsù ìlà oòrùnUganda, bíríkìlà kan lá dùúgbò ibẹ̀ rí ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́, ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ à ti ìwà-bí-ọ̀rẹ́ tó wà lá àárín à wọn ará, èyí sì wú u lórí débi pé ó wá bá wọn ṣiṣẹ́ níbẹ̀ lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́.

jw2019

In the western rift, volcanic movement has formed the Ruwenzori and Virunga mountain ranges that straddle the borders of Rwanda, Zaire, and Uganda.
jw2019

(Acts 15:30-32) Bottom: A circuit overseer speaks to a congregation in Uganda.

Iye yii ko kan awọn wọnni ti a pa ninu diẹ lara awọn ogun atajẹsilẹ julọ ti o ṣẹṣẹ wa si opin ni ọdun ti o ṣaaju, iru bii ti Uganda, Afghanistan, ati Iran oun Iraq.
This figure excludes those killed in some of the bloodiest wars that had just come to a halt in the previous year, such as those in Uganda, Afghanistan, and Iran-Iraq.
jw2019
Ọ̀ọ́dúnrún mìíràn ń gbé inú igbó dídí ilẹ̀ Uganda tí kò ṣeé wọ̀.
Another 300 dwell in the impenetrable forest in Uganda.
jw2019
Ipò tá a wà náà ni Brian òun Marion Wallace àtàwọn ọmọ wọn méjèèjì wa, àwọn náà sì pinnu láti dúró sí Uganda.
Brian and Marion Wallace and their two children were in a position similar to ours, and they also decided to stay in Uganda.
jw2019
Gbogbo nǹkan ń lọ déédéé títí di àárọ̀ ọjọ́ kan tá a gbọ́ lórí rédíò pé ìjọba ilẹ̀ Uganda ti fòfin de àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
Conditions remained calm until one morning when we heard on the radio that the Uganda government had banned Jehovah’s Witnesses.

West Nile virus, transmitted to man primarily by mosquitoes, was first isolated in 1937 in Uganda and later observed in the Middle East, Asia, Oceania, and Europe.
jw2019
Kò pẹ́ tí Knut àti Lisbeth fi rí i pé àwọn ti wà ní sẹpẹ́ láti lọ sìn ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè. Torí náà, wọ́n lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Uganda.
Before long, Knut and Lisbeth felt ready to make the move, and a big one at that —to Uganda.
jw2019
Abẹ́ àwọn igi máńgòrò kan tó ní ibòji dáadáa ni ìjọ kékeré kan tó wà ní àríwá Uganda ti ń ṣèpàdé tẹ́lẹ̀.
A small congregation in northern Uganda used to hold meetings under some densely leaved mango trees.
jw2019
Lásìkò tá a fẹ́ ṣe àpéjọ yẹn, póòpù ń bọ̀ wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Uganda, àwọn èèyàn sì ń múra sílẹ̀ dè é.
At the time, people were preparing for the pope’s visit.
jw2019
□ Iriri miiran ti ó fi ọgbọn jijẹrii lọna àìjẹ́-bí-àṣà han wá lati Kampala, Uganda.
□ Another experience that shows the wisdom of informal witnessing comes from Kampala, Uganda.
jw2019
Kò pẹ́ lẹ́yìn náà ni mo sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní Pápákọ̀ Òfuurufú Ńlá ti Entebbe lórílẹ̀-èdè Uganda, níbi tá a ti lo ọdún mẹ́rin àti oṣù méje.
Not long thereafter, I received employment at Entebbe International Airport, in Uganda, where we would stay for four years and seven months.
jw2019
Nígbà tá a wà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Uganda, ẹ̀ẹ̀mejì ni rògbòdìyàn ńlá bẹ́ sílẹ̀, àmọ́ èyí kò dá àwọn ìgbòkègbodò tẹ̀mí wa dúró rárá.
Civil unrest broke out twice in Uganda while we were there, but that did not bring our spiritual activities to a halt.
jw2019
Àwa tá a kù ní Uganda sì ń ṣe àwọn ìpàdé ìjọ nìṣó, bẹ́ẹ̀ la sì ń bá iṣẹ́ ìwàásù wa lọ, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọgbọ́n la fi ń ṣe é.
Those of us left in Uganda kept on with our Christian meetings and the preaching work, although we had to be prudent and cautious.
jw2019
Àmọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ rẹpẹtẹ èèyàn tó ti sá wá sí Uganda nítorí ogun tí wọ́n ń jà láwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó wà lágbègbè ibẹ̀ ń fẹ́ àfiyèsí ní kánjúkánjú.
However, an urgent concern is the large number of refugees who have streamed into Uganda.
jw2019
Lẹ́yìn tí mo sìn ní Uganda fún sáà kan, mo dé Dar es Salaam, tí í ṣe olú ìlú Tanganyika, níbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 1956.
After serving in Uganda for some time, I arrived early in 1956 in Dar es Salaam, the capital of Tanganyika.
jw2019
Láti fi hàn bí ilẹ̀ Uganda ṣe lọ́ràá tó, wọ́n máa ń pa á láṣamọ̀ níbẹ̀ pé tó o bá ti igi lásán bọ ilẹ̀ Uganda lálẹ́, tó bá fi máa dàárọ̀ yóò ti ta gbòǹgbò.
It has been said that if you drive a stick into the fertile soil of Uganda in the evening, it will have roots in the morning.
jw2019
Lọ́dún 1971, ogun abẹ́lé tó ṣẹlẹ̀ kò jẹ́ ká ní ìfọ̀kànbalẹ̀ mọ́ ní Uganda.
In 1971 civil war shattered our peace in Uganda.
jw2019
Ní Uganda, Stanley àti Esinala Makumba jẹ́ orísun ìṣírí fún ìdílé wa
In Uganda, Stanley and Esinala Makumba were a source of encouragement to our family
jw2019
A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà Ọlọ́run pé ó ṣì fàyè sílẹ̀ kí púpọ̀ sí i lára àwọn èèyàn onírúurú ẹ̀yà tó wà ní Uganda lè gbọ́ nípa Ìjọba rẹ̀.
We thank Jehovah God for allowing time for yet more of Uganda’s diverse people to learn about his Kingdom.
jw2019
Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Africa News ti June 22, 2006, ń ṣàlàyé nípa “àpérò kan tó dá lórí ìṣekúṣe àti wíwo àwọn ohun tó ń mú ọkàn èèyàn fà sí ìṣekúṣe,” èyí tó máa ń wáyé láwọn ilé jẹ́gẹjẹ̀gẹ tí wọ́n kọ́ sapá ibì kan báyìí lórílẹ̀-èdè Uganda, ó sọ pé “pípa táwọn òbí pa àwọn ọmọ wọn tì ló mú kí iṣẹ́ aṣẹ́wó àti lílo oògùn olóró pọ̀ sí i ládùúgbò náà.”
Africa News of June 22, 2006, reporting on a “workshop on sexual abuse and pornography” in slums in one part of Uganda, said it is the “parent’s neglect that has increased prostitution and drug abuse in the area.”
jw2019
Nígbà tí iṣẹ́ kíkọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lápá gúúsù ìlà oòrùn Uganda, bíríkìlà kan ládùúgbò ibẹ̀ rí ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́, ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti ìwà-bí-ọ̀rẹ́ tó wà láàárín àwọn ará, èyí sì wú u lórí débi pé ó wá báwọn ṣiṣẹ́ níbẹ̀ lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́.
At a Kingdom Hall building project in the southeastern part of the country, a local mason was so moved by the spirit of friendliness, love, and cooperation he observed among the brothers that he volunteered to help with the work.
jw2019
Orílẹ̀-ède India ni wọ́n bí bàbá mi sí, ọmọ ilẹ̀ India ni ìyá mi náà, àmọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè Uganda ní wọ́n bí wọn sí.
My father was born in India, and my mother, although of Indian origin, was born in Uganda.

examples.english: Brother Swingle was born on November 6, 1910, in Lincoln, Nebraska, but soon afterward the family moved to Salt Lake City, Utah.

examples.yoruba: Nígbà tí mo tún lọ ṣe ìwá dìí ní ibi tí à wọn ẹlẹ́sìn Mormon ń kó ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbá yé sí ní ìpínlẹ̀Utah, mo rí i pé òótọ́ ni gbogbo ohun tí mo kà nínú ìwé ìròyìn Jí! yẹn.
examples.english: It was, and those facts were further confirmed when I visited Mormon museums in Utah.

examples.yoruba: Lá ti ọdún 1868 ni ìjọba United States ti pín ilẹ̀ tí a yà sọ́tọ̀ tí ó tó 62,000 kìlómítà níbùú lóròó fún à wọn ará Navajo ní à ríwá ìlà oòrùn Arizona, nítòsí ibi tí a pè ní igun mẹ́rin, níbi tí à wọn ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́rin náà, Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, à tiUtahti pà dé.
examples.english: Since 1868 the United States government has apportioned to the Navajo some 24,000 square miles [62,000 sq km] of reservation land in northeastern Arizona, around what is called four corners, where the four states of Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, and Utahmeet.

examples.yoruba: Ìwé ìròyìn Deseret News ti ìlú Salt Lake City, ní ìpínlẹ̀Utahkí yè sí à wọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, ó sì sọ pé “ìdílé wọn máa ń wà pa pọ̀ bí òṣùṣù ọwọ̀, wọ́n ṣeé fọkàn tán lá wùjọ, wọ́n sì máa ń ṣiṣẹ́ ká ra.”
examples.english: The Deseret News of Salt Lake City, Utah, observed that Jehovah's Witnesses “promote strong family ties and develop productive and honest citizens.”

examples.yoruba: Níto rí pé bí ìwé ìròyìn “What's Up,” tí Àjọ Àwọn Aṣèwá dìí Nípa Ẹgbẹ́ Ọmọ Ìta níUtahń ṣe, ti sọ, “nígbà tí à wọn èwé bá nímọ̀lá ra pé a nífẹ̀ẹ́ à wọn, pé à wọn sì lá àbò—kì í ṣe à à bò ní ti owó, bí kò ṣe ní ti ìmọ̀lá ra—à wọn à ìní tí ó máa ń sún wọn wọ ẹgbẹ́ ọmọ ìta sá bà máa ń pòórá.”
examples.english: Because as “What's Up,” a magazine published by the Utah Gang Investigators Association, said, “when youths feel loved and secure—not financially secure, but emotionally secure—the needs that drive them into gangs often vanish.”
